summary: the aim of the following study was to describe the interrelationship between villagers, domestic animals and wildlife at the Community Forestry Concession of Uaxactn, Guatemala. the main focus was generating information regarding different livestock diseases considered important by villagers and their relevance, as well as obtaining knowledge about hunting activities and cooking methods. agricultural and hunting activities represent a risk factor for the spread of diseases. hunters may act as mechanical vectors for different pathogens within domestic and wild animal populations.
